gov.usgs.traveltime

Class AllBrnVol

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.traveltime.AllBrnVol

  • public class AllBrnVol
extends java.lang.Object
    Umbrella storage for all volatile branch level travel-time data.
    Author:
    Ray Buland

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AllBrnVol(AllBrnRef ref)
      Set up volatile copies of data that changes with depth.

    • Method Detail

      • getEarthModel

        public java.lang.String getEarthModel()
        Get the earth model name.
        Returns:
        Earth model name

      • newSession

        public void newSession(double latitude,
                       double longitude,
                       double depth,
                       java.lang.String[] phList,
                       boolean useful,
                       boolean noBackBrn,
                       boolean tectonic,
                       boolean rstt,
                       boolean plot)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Set up a new session. Note that this sets up the complex session parameters of use to the travel-time package.
        Parameters:
        latitude - Source geographical latitude in degrees
        longitude - Source longitude in degrees
        depth - Source depth in kilometers
        phList - Array of phase use commands
        useful - If true, only provide "useful" crustal phases
        tectonic - If true, map Pb and Sb onto Pg and Sg
        noBackBrn - If true, suppress back branches
        rstt - If true, use RSTT crustal phases
        plot - If true, compute travel-time plot data
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the depth is out of range

      • newSession

        public void newSession(double depth,
                       java.lang.String[] phList,
                       boolean useful,
                       boolean noBackBrn,
                       boolean tectonic,
                       boolean rstt,
                       boolean plot)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Set up a new session. Note that this just sets up the simple session parameters of use to the travel-time package.
        Parameters:
        depth - Source depth in kilometers
        phList - Array of phase use commands
        useful - If true, only provide "useful" crustal phases
        tectonic - If true, map Pb and Sb onto Pg and Sg
        noBackBrn - If true, suppress back branches
        rstt - If true, use RSTT crustal phases
        plot - If true, compute travel-time plot data
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the depth is out of range

      • getTT

        public TTime getTT(double latitude,
                   double longitude,
                   double elev,
                   double delta,
                   double azimuth)
        Get the arrival times from all branches for a "complex" request (i.e., including latitude and longitude). This will include the ellipticity and bounce point corrections as well as the elevation correction.
        Parameters:
        latitude - Receiver geographic latitude in degrees
        longitude - Receiver longitude in degrees
        elev - Station elevation in kilometers
        delta - Source receiver distance desired in degrees
        azimuth - Receiver azimuth at the source in degrees
        Returns:
        An array list of travel times

      • getTT

        public TTime getTT(double elev,
                   double delta)
        Get the arrival times from all branches for a "simple" request (i.e., without latitude and longitude. This will only include the elevation correction.
        Parameters:
        elev - Station elevation in kilometers
        delta - Source receiver distance desired in degrees
        Returns:
        An array list of travel times

      • elevCorr

        public double elevCorr(java.lang.String phCode,
                       double elev,
                       double dTdD,
                       boolean rstt)
        Compute the elevation correction for one phase.
        Parameters:
        phCode - Phase code
        elev - Elevation in kilometers
        dTdD - Ray parameter in seconds/degree
        rstt - True if RSTT is being used for crustal phases
        Returns:
        Elevation correction in seconds

      • ellipCorr

        public double ellipCorr(double eqLat,
                        double depth,
                        double delta,
                        double azimuth,
                        boolean upGoing)
        Compute the ellipticity correction for one phase.
        Parameters:
        eqLat - Hypocenter geographic latitude in degrees
        depth - Hypocenter depth in kilometers
        delta - Source-receiver distance in degrees
        azimuth - Receiver azimuth from the source in degrees
        upGoing - True if the phase is an up-going P or S
        Returns:
        Ellipticity correction in seconds

      • reflCorr

        public double reflCorr(java.lang.String phCode,
                       BrnDataRef brnRef,
                       double eqLat,
                       double eqLon,
                       double delta,
                       double azimuth,
                       double dTdD,
                       double delCorUp,
                       double delCorDn)
        Compute the bounce point correction due to the reflection occurring at some elevation other than zero. This will provide a positive correction for bounces under mountains and a negative correction for bounces at the bottom of the ocean. Note that pwP is a very special case as it will only exist if pP bounces at the bottom of the ocean.
        Parameters:
        phCode - Phase code
        brnRef - Branch data reference object
        eqLat - Geographic source latitude in degrees
        eqLon - Source longitude in degrees
        delta - Source-receiver distance in degrees
        azimuth - Receiver azimuth from the source in degrees
        dTdD - Ray parameter in seconds per degree
        delCorUp - Source-bounce point distance in degrees for an up-going ray
        delCorDn - Source-bounce point distance in degrees for a down-going ray
        Returns:
        Bounce point correction in seconds

      • oneRay

        public double oneRay(java.lang.String phCode,
                     double dTdD)
              throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute the distance and travel-time for one surface focus ray.
        Parameters:
        phCode - Phase code for the desired branch
        dTdD - Desired ray parameter in seconds/degree
        Returns:
        Source-receiver distance in degrees
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the desired arrival doesn't exist

      • upRay

        public double upRay(java.lang.String phCode,
                    double dTdD)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Compute the distance and travel-time for the portion of a surface focus ray cut off by the source depth. This provides the distance needed to correct a down-going ray to surface focus.
        Parameters:
        phCode - Phase code of the phase being corrected
        dTdD - Desired ray parameter in seconds/degree
        Returns:
        Distance cut off in degrees
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the up-going arrival doesn't exist

      • getTimeCorr

        public double getTimeCorr()
        Getter for the time correction computed by the last call to oneRay or upRay.
        Returns:
        travel-time in seconds

      • dumpHead

        public void dumpHead()
        Print global or header data for debugging purposes.

      • dumpTable

        public void dumpTable(boolean useful)
        Print a summary table of branch information similar to the FORTRAN Ttim range list.
        Parameters:
        useful - If true, only print "useful" crustal phases

      • dumpMod

        public void dumpMod(char typeMod,
                    boolean nice)
        Print model parameters for debugging purposes.
        Parameters:
        typeMod - Wave type ('P' or 'S')
        nice - If true print the model in dimensional units

      • dumpBrn

        public void dumpBrn(int iBrn,
                    boolean full,
                    boolean all,
                    boolean sci,
                    boolean useful)
        Print data for one travel-time branch for debugging purposes.
        Parameters:
        iBrn - Branch number
        full - If true, print the detailed branch specification as well
        all - If true print even more specifications
        sci - if true, print in scientific notation
        useful - If true, only print "useful" crustal phases

      • dumpBrn

        public void dumpBrn(java.lang.String seg,
                    boolean full,
                    boolean all,
                    boolean sci,
                    boolean useful)
        Print data for one travel-time segment for debugging purposes.
        Parameters:
        seg - Segment phase code
        full - If true, print the detailed branch specification as well
        all - If true print even more specifications
        sci - if true, print in scientific notation
        useful - If true, only print "useful" crustal phases

      • dumpBrn

        public void dumpBrn(boolean full,
                    boolean all,
                    boolean sci,
                    boolean useful)
        Print data for all travel-time segments for debugging purposes.
        Parameters:
        full - If true, print the detailed branch specification as well
        all - If true print even more specifications
        sci - if true, print in scientific notation
        useful - If true, only print "useful" crustal phases

      • dumpCorrUp

        public void dumpCorrUp(char typeUp,
                       boolean full)
        Print data for one corrected up-going branch for debugging purposes.
        Parameters:
        typeUp - Wave type ('P' or 'S')
        full - If true print the up-going tau values as well

                      boolean full)
        Print data for one decimated up-going branch for debugging purposes.
        Parameters:

        full - If true print the up-going tau values as well
